intro: Agalma griffithii, commonly known as the Griffith's agalma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern and southeastern Asia, including parts of India and Nepal. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Agalma griffithii is considered a rare and endangered species.
